III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
R 400.4144 Admission health screening; physical examinations.
(2) An institution shall have the following documentation of
an admission physical examination for each resident,
unless an earlier examination is medically indicated:
(b) For a resident 3 years of age or older, a physical
examination shall have been completed within 1 year prior
to admission or a new physical examination shall be
completed within 30 calendar days after admission.
One of three youth did not have a physical examination within
30 days after admission. COVID-19 restrictions were not a
barrier during that time.
R 400.4166 Discharge plan.
(1) When a resident is discharged from institutional care, all
of the following information shall be documented in the
case record within 14 days after discharge:
(e) A statement that the discharge plan
recommendations, including medical and dental follow up
that is needed, have been reviewed with the resident and
with the parent and with the responsible case manager.
For one of eight discharged youth, there was no evidence that
medical information was reviewed with the resident,
parent and/or responsible case manager. This is because the
discharge medical information was documented electronically
and not written on the discharge form that is given to parents/
guardians.
4

2.) The facility is in compliance will all ISEP requirements.
3.) The facility is in compliance will all MDDHS Contract/Policies.
IV. CONSULTATION
I conducted unannounced visits at the facility and verified CAP compliance
monthly from November 2020 through March 2021. As of February 10, 2021,
compliance for all outstanding CAPs was verified. Details can be found on the CCI
Compliance Monitoring spreadsheet.
V. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
The facility was placed on a First Provisional license on October 19, 2020 as a
result of special investigations 2020C0108055 and 2020C0108060 in which repeat
violations were established for Resident Restraint and Program Statement (staff
failing to follow Vista Maria’s policies and procedure).
In November 2020, the agency chose to voluntarily transfer all of the youth and
staff out of Donna Maria and Lourdes Halls and have not serviced youth under
this license since that time. If the agency decides to accept referrals on this
license in the future, they have agreed to notify me beforehand and I will provide
consultation to address any changes in programming and/or the terms of the
license.
During this licensing period, the facility submitted three additional corrective
action plans for the following licensing rule violations:
 R 400.4158 Discipline (verbal)
 R 400.4112 Staff qualifications
 R 400.4127 Staff to resident ratio
 R 400.4126 Sufficiency of staff
VI. RECOMMENDATION
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan for the two violations listed in the
body, I recommend Vista Maria’s Specialty Residential be returned to a Regular license.
